• Written open source software before (posted on GitHub ( https://github.com/ ) or the like)
• An innate, heightened urgency to complete projects on time and with high quality
• Released software products of your own original creation
• A cover letter that introduces yourself and explains why you are the top candidate for this internship
• Create your own PubNub demo with a well-written README file (make us say WOW). Submit a link to your PubNub app via GitHub/BitBucket etc.
• Optional: A link to a published blog post on a technology blog (like Medium) that is a "build your own" tutorial of your open source software project
• What It's Like to Intern at PubNub with Lizzie Siegle ( https://www.pubnub.com/blog/2016-08-25-what-its-like-to-intern-at-pubnub/ )
• How to Build Your Own HQ Trivia App for Android ( https://www.pubnub.com/blog/build-your-own-hq-trivia-app-for-android/ )
• Build Your Own Uber/Lyft App with Geolocation Tracking for Android Devices ( https://www.pubnub.com/blog/build-your-own-uber-lyft-app-geolocation-tracking-android/ )

What is PubNub?---------------PubNub ( https://www.pubnub.com ) is the real-time API. It enables users to connect their devices, deliver data, and control systems using our global data streaming network. Think of it like SMS for the internet. In fact, 10% of devices on Earth send data with PubNub every day.We deliver trillions of monthly real-time messages for financial services, chat apps, online auctions, multiplayer games, telecom infrastructure, rideshare/taxi apps, retail apps and more.PubNub also enables many Internet of Things (IoT) solutions for home automation, connected cars, retail, transportation and many others. Recently, Tom London used PubNub on America's Got Talent ( https://youtu.be/Q6RrzJ7u_UU?t=47 ), which he explained in the article A Magician Never Reveals his Secret — Unless it's for Hacker Noon ( https://hackernoon.com/a-magician-never-reveals-his-secret-unless-its-for-hacker-noon-7f3c29158c18 ).Job Summary-----------Join PubNub for an unordinary summer in San Francisco. We are looking for Software Developers that dream about building awesome technology products. You will work on the Developer Relations Engineering team to build catchy, viral software projects that grab the attention of software engineers all over the world.Your code will demonstrate the power of PubNub in real-world applications. You will work with the Engineering team and Marketing team to write exemplary code and megaphone your work across the internet.This is a 3-4 month, 40 hour per week, paid internship. The position is full time and onsite at PubNub HQ in San Francisco ( https://www.google.com/maps?q=pubnub&um=1&ie=UTF-8&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwj8_vHOl63fAhWLerwKHfavADUQ_AUIDygC ) during normal business hours. Your job title will be Developer Relations Intern.Responsibilities----------------Required Experience-------------------Bonus Experience----------------Application-----------To Apply, please submitExample PubNub App Submissions------------------------------Create a compelling demo using a PubNub SDK ( https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.pubnub.com_docs_web-2Djavascript_pubnub-2Djavascript-2Dsdk-23how-5Fto-5Fget-5Fit-5Fcdn&d=DwMFAA&c=clK7kQUTWtAVEOVIgvi0NU5BOUHhpN0H8p7CSfnc_gI&r=mAK3c8xUYXPCReqPqW6c_w&m=yJSY_nHMjuWej3KfB4yqwom4B8c53w7byassLrqFjhc&s=EudMz8kP7wmr852w-SHR6ML0crk0Q0EGVWkLgZAb_vU&e= ). The only requirement is that you use a PubNub SDK. You may spend as much or as little time on this project as you wish. Your submission can be similar to any of these past PubNub code example repositories:Previous Intern Projects and Blogs----------------------------------

summary: Developing tools for increased quality assurance of Ethereum smart contracts. Reserve is a blockchain-based project that is developing a cryptocurrency that is...
title: Software Verification Engineer
text:
Reserve is a blockchain-based project that is developing a cryptocurrency that is supposed to be pegged to the U.S. dollar, called a stablecoin. It will be inexpensive to send and provide users access to the benefits of cryptocurrencies without the volatility. While we expect that Reserve will be valuable to traders and app developers inside the crypto ecosystem, we’re most excited about it replacing inflationary currencies and dysfunctional banks. And with the currencies in Venezuela, Argentina, Turkey, and elsewhere approaching hyperinflation, now seems like the right moment for people to choose something new.



 Decentralized currencies have the opportunity to change global financial and monetary institutions for the better. If you’re excited by this idea, we would love to hear from you.



If you'd like to learn more about what we're working on, check out this recent interview of our CEO Nevin Freeman on the podcast Hidden Forces: https://www.hiddenforces.io/podcast/show/hard-prob....

Without formal verification, any nontrivial contract deployed on the blockchain will eventually fail, but the tools for carrying out verification on these contracts are still in their infancy. You will take on the critical challenge of formally verifying that our smart contract is correct and secure. Here are some responsibilities you’ll take on for that goal:

In your application please link to some code that you wrote that reflects your abilities (e.g. github).

title: Software Engineer
text:
Reserve is a blockchain-based project that is developing a cryptocurrency that is supposed to be pegged to the U.S. dollar, called a stablecoin. It will be inexpensive to send and provide users access to the benefits of cryptocurrencies without the volatility. While we expect that Reserve will be valuable to traders and app developers inside the crypto ecosystem, we’re most excited about it replacing inflationary currencies and dysfunctional banks. And with the currencies in Venezuela, Argentina, Turkey, and elsewhere approaching hyperinflation, now seems like the right moment for people to choose something new.

 

 Decentralized currencies have the opportunity to change global financial and monetary institutions for the better. If you’re excited by this idea, we would love to hear from you.



If you'd like to learn more about what we're working on, check out this recent interview of our CEO Nevin Freeman on the podcast Hidden Forces: https://www.hiddenforces.io/podcast/show/hard-prob....

We are taking a maximally nimble approach to developing extraordinarily robust programs, and the best practices in the domains we’re working in change on a month-by-month basis. This role therefore requires substantial methodological flexibility. You will support the engineering team with its mission to efficiently ship smart contracts that are correct and secure, and adapt along the way to improved processes. Here are some example responsibilities you’ll take on towards that goal:



 In your application please link to some code that you wrote that reflects your abilities (e.g. github).

text:

text:

• Understanding of enterprise computing environments, distributed applications, and a strong understanding of TCP/IP networks

summary: BitGo is pioneering true safety and security for digital currencies like Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple, Bitcoin Cash and many more....
title: Senior Product Manager - Custody
text:
BitGo is the market leader in institutional-grade cryptocurrency investment services providing security, compliance, and custodial solutions for blockchain-based currencies. BitGo is the world's largest processor of on-chain bitcoin transactions, processing 15% of all global Bitcoin transactions, and $15 billion per month across all cryptocurrencies. The company has over $2 billion in assets in wallet, and a customer base that includes the world's largest cryptocurrency exchanges and spans more than 50 countries. In 2018, it launched BitGo Trust Company, the first qualified custodian purpose-built for storing digital assets. BitGo is backed by Craft Ventures, DRW, Galaxy Digital Ventures, Goldman Sachs, Redpoint Ventures, and Valor Equity Partners.



 BitGo is looking for a highly motivated Senior Product Manager who will join our Engineering Product team in Palo Alto.



Join BitGo’s fast-based product team as a Product Manager and help us to design, build and release cutting-edge blockchain products. You must thrive in a fast-paced environment, have strong understanding of software fundamentals, excellent communication skills, and a desire to work with technical teams to develop groundbreaking digital currency products.

Be a part of the team that is enabling digital currencies to extend beyond the fringe and into mainstream business. BitGo is pioneering true safety and security for digital currencies like Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple, Bitcoin Cash and many more. We’re growing and we’re winning.

We need great people who strive for excellence in all their endeavors and who have a track record of success. We are looking for candidates who are not risk averse and want to build products that will change the world. We aspire to foster a working environment, culture and leadership team that inspires greatness on a daily basis through transparency, ownership and integrity.
• Gain a deep understanding of customer needs, identify and fill product gaps and generate new ideas to drive growth
• Create buy-in for the product vision and translate product strategy into detailed requirements
• Scope and prioritize activities based on business and customer impact
• Lead multiple Palo Alto-based engineering teams to tackle technical complexities, organize and plan execution paths and deliver new products and features to the market
• Stay informed of the overall market landscape, including competitors and potential partners
• Evaluate promotional plans to ensure that they are consistent with product line strategy and that the message is effectively conveyed
• Proven work experience in financial services industry, preferably working with Institutional customers such as hedge funds, asset managers, OTC desks and/or exchanges
• Passion for driving product innovation and a track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
• Excellent written and verbal communications skills; ability to translate strategy into clear and actionable plans and effectively communicate cross functionally within Product Development, Engineering, Design and Sales.
• Strong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done
• Curiosity to learn BitGo’s business and ability to adapt past experiences to BitGo’s current opportunities
• Ability to set priorities and work well independently

Disrupting an industry takes vision, innovation, passion, technical chops, drive to deliver, collaboration, and execution. Join a team of great people who strive for excellence and personify our corporate values of ownership, craftsmanship, and open communication. We are looking for new colleagues who bring innovative ways of thinking and problem solving, and who want risks to be part of the team that changes the world’s financial markets.



 Here are some of the benefits of working at BitGo:
• Computer equipment and workplace furniture to suit your needs

Cryptocurrencies are the most disruptive change the financial services industry has seen in years. Join us and you’ll be able to look back and say you were part of the team that transformed investing.

title: Senior Platform Engineer, Kiva Protocol
text:
• Use blockchain technology to solve identity challenges and expand financial access in unbanked populations
• Contribute to the support and monitoring of the systems you create
• Implement simplicity-focused solutions for audiences that may have limited exposure to mobile and web-based technologies
• Help foster a spirit of innovation and collaboration both within the engineering team and across the organization
• Juggle a desire to move quickly with a passion for maintainable, well-crafted code
• A passion for best practices, fast delivery, and agile methodologies
• An amazing mission: Kiva's mission is to connect people through lending to alleviate poverty across the globe.
• An opportunity to improve real lives, solve hard problems, and change the world.
• Friendly, supportive, and adventurous environment with a team of engaged colleagues.
• Opportunities to connect with and learn from colleagues and partners around the world.

Kiva (www.kiva.org) is an innovative non-profit that combines the culture and technological passion of an internet start-up with the compassion and empathy of a non-profit to address poverty at global scale. In just 13 years, we have raised more than $1.1 billion in loan capital for 2.7 million borrowers in 83 countries. With offices in San Francisco, Portland, New York, Nairobi, and Bangkok, Kiva's team includes 100+ employees and 400+ volunteers worldwide.Recently announced at the United Nations General Assembly, Kiva is partnering with the government of Sierra Leone and United Nations to build a blockchain-based credit system that will unlock financial services for many of the world's poorest and most underbanked citizens. As a Senior Platform Engineer, you'll be a foundational member of a new team developing back-end technology to help populations across Sierra Leone (and ultimately the globe) escape poverty.The ideal candidate takes initiative and is passionate about both our organizational mission and our high standards in engineering. We produce results by giving engineers full ownership and the resources they need to work as efficiently as possible.This role will be based in San Francisco, Portland or Austin and will report to the Engineering Director based in San Francisco. At this time, we can only consider applicants with authorization to work in the United States on a permanent, full-time basis; unfortunately we cannot provide visa sponsorship.What We OfferA diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is an integral part of Kiva's culture. We actively welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a great place to work. Join us and help us achieve our mission!We will only accept applications directly from candidates. Kiva will not be responsible for any recruiting agency fees, absent a formal agreement.

title: Director of Customer Support
text:
• Lead and inspire a growing team of Gemini Customer Support associates, as well as a remote team, to deliver exceptional customer support
• Drive customer satisfaction and retention through initial customer onboarding, ongoing support and retention initiatives
• Manage client insights function to develop a proactive client services model, inform on business initiatives, and report on trends in the fast-paced world of cryptocurrencies
• Advocate as the voice of the customer within Gemini when collaborating cross-functionally with Marketing, Finance, Product & Engineering teams
• Work with Managing Director of Operations in revamping a new support service model

• Experience with with retail customer support, familiarity with institutional support a plus
• Proficiency in leveraging a range of tools to build and communicate data-driven recommendations
• Excellent listening and communication skills, coupled with strong interpersonal and relationship management skills
• Ability to motivate others to do complicated tasks and fulfill their potential
• Adaptability to manage uncertainty; balancing multiple competing objectives and timelines, and making sensible compromises to push your team forward. Ability to take on new initiatives and build them into the customer service team's workflow.
• Problem solver, creative thinker, and not afraid to experiment
• Experience in financial services or fintech support
• Ownership in the company via profit sharing units

Help us Build the Future of MoneyGemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!Customer SupportThe Customer Support team at Gemini is a team group of highly talented and dynamic contributors. Each individual ensures that our customers have the best experience possible when they need help, have a question or are providing feedback. This team manages all inbound service requests, communications with customers while onboarding, and is increasingly contributing to outbound communications. summary: We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant...
title: Director of Customer Support
text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

The Customer Support team at Gemini is a team group of highly talented and dynamic contributors. Each individual ensures that our customers have the best experience possible when they need help, have a question or are providing feedback. This team manages all inbound service requests, communications with customers while onboarding, and is increasingly contributing to outbound communications. The Customer Support teams main focus is our Retail customers, but increasingly they are interacting with Institutional Customers. During periods of low-service volume, the team also takes on support-centric projects.

Gemini is looking for a self-motivated, personable, hands-on individual who is experienced and eager to lead the Customer Support team. As the leader of our Customer Support Team, you’ll directly manage a team associates in NYC, as well as lead a remote support team. You’ll be responsible for ensuring the quality of our service remains best-in-class, maximizing efficiency, developing relationships with other departments to ensure our customers’ needs are being met, and continuing to build upon the team’s rapidly evolving infrastructure.

This position is full-time at Gemini’s offices in New York City, and will report to the Managing Director of Operations.
• Lead and inspire a growing team of Gemini Customer Support associates, as well as a remote team, to deliver exceptional customer support
• Drive customer satisfaction and retention through initial customer onboarding, ongoing support and retention initiatives
• Manage client insights function to develop a proactive client services model, inform on business initiatives, and report on trends in the fast-paced world of cryptocurrencies
• Advocate as the voice of the customer within Gemini when collaborating cross-functionally with Marketing, Finance, Product & Engineering teams
• Work with Managing Director of Operations in revamping a new support service model
• Define and drive key performance indicators (KPIs) for the customer support team
• 6-10 years of professional experience in Customer Support, with 3-5 years of management experience with Customer Support or Client Services teams
• Experience with with retail customer support, familiarity with institutional support a plus
• Proficiency in leveraging a range of tools to build and communicate data-driven recommendations
• Excellent listening and communication skills, coupled with strong interpersonal and relationship management skills
• Ability to motivate others to do complicated tasks and fulfill their potential
• Adaptability to manage uncertainty; balancing multiple competing objectives and timelines, and making sensible compromises to push your team forward. Ability to take on new initiatives and build them into the customer service team’s workflow.
• Problem solver, creative thinker, and not afraid to experiment
• Experience in financial services or fintech support

It Pays to Work Here

We take a holistic approach to compensation at Gemini, which includes:
• Ownership in the company via profit sharing units

Gemini is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

summary: Bitcoin Depot is one of the largest multi-cryptocurrency ATM Networks in the world offering users the ability to buy and sell Bitcoin, Litecoin, Ethereum, and...
title: AML Compliance Analyst
text:
We are seeking an experienced AML Compliance Analyst to join our team in Atlanta, Ga (Buckhead area). However, remote employment will be considered if you are not local. SALARY: $40K - $50K

Who we are:

Bitcoin Depot is one of the largest multi-cryptocurrency ATM Networks in the world offering users the ability to buy and sell Bitcoin, Litecoin, Ethereum, and Bitcoin Cash instantly at hundreds of locations. Our mission is to provide the most secure, convenient, and fastest cryptocurrency transaction. Our vision is to bring cryptocurrency market to the masses. Go to bitcoindepot.com for more information

The AML Compliance Analyst will be responsible for assisting the Compliance Officer with the Company's Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) compliance program, including Know Your Customer, Customer Due Diligence and Enhanced Due Diligence activities. Analyst will review and analyze transactional data for potential suspicious activity, including those generated from an alert detection process, subpoenas and warrants, country/corridor reviews, foreign and domestic agent matters (when applicable), consumer network cases, negative media reports, as well as other sources as applicable.

The analysis will work effectively with multiple complex data sources and/or technical analytical tools/resources to identify potentially unusual or suspicious activity as defined by AML/BSA regulations and industry best practices for AML/BSA analysis. This includes (but is not limited to):
• Assist the Compliance Officer with the investigative process from initial detection to disposition and filing.
• Thoroughly and timely reviews reports and other investigative leads that potentially identify suspicious activity.
• Formulates and recommends responses to potentially suspicious findings, reports such activity to the appropriate regulatory authorities and supports Bitcoin Depot’s forward-looking risk-mitigation process(es).
• Write and file Suspicious Activity Reports and apply appropriate risk mitigation measures.
• Conduct customer due diligence (CDD), enhanced due diligence (EDD), and third party due diligence as needed.
• Assist with writing, managing and ensuring timely and accurate filing of required reports to FinCEN such as SARs and CTRs
• Preparing management and board reports that includes insights and analysis.
• Assist with preparing the Company to undergo an annual independent review.
• 2+ years of experience with implementing or analyzing financial regulatory compliance programs in MSBs. Working in cryptocurrency is ideal.
• Knowledge of BSA and AML regulations and equivalent compliance programs implemented by regulated institutions
• Knowledge of conducting investigations, examinations, or audits of financial institutions
• Knowledge of the analysis of people, activities, methods, or trends, including money laundering, financial crime or other illicit activities
• Ability to write concisely and clearly with minimal editing
• Broad financial services knowledge and knowledge of industry best practices for continuously improving a proactive BSA/AML program.
• Strong collaboration and leadership abilities to strategically manage to high performance outcomes.

text:

summary: Cryptocurrencies (Bitcoin, Ethereum). Are you a passionate FinTech Professional with a knack for changing lives?...
title: Part-Time Curriculum Engineer (FinTech)
text:
• Someone with at least 3-5+ years of industry experience in the financial technology sector. We're ideally looking for someone who has worked both in large organizations environments and in smaller startups.
• Someone with a lot of hands-on experience. We're building a program in which students learn by doing! At a minimum, you should have a strong familiarity with tools like:
• Someone who absolutely loves teaching and sharing knowledge with others. It's ideal if you've taught financial technology or programming in the past. Major plus if you've spoken at fintech conferences.
• Someone with a creative itch! This program will require a great deal of ingenuity and setup to create at scale. We want someone who is excited by the idea of creating KYC applications in blockchain or machine learning powered trading algorithms.
• Someone who is a lot of fun! We want learning technology to be exciting, engaging, and a little funny. Imagine an engineering class that feels like a Disney movie. We need fun people to make this a reality.
• Someone who can manage a team. We've got a team of brilliant curriculum developers who can build amazing modules. We want someone who can bring expertise and new vision to the program. We're looking for a true tech titan.
• Someone who isn't afraid to get their hands dirty. In this capacity, you'll be responsible for keeping a living curriculum up-to-date for hundreds of Instructors and TAs across the country. This means managing issues, pull requests, and bug fixes. It also means taking in community input on technology trends. We need someone with a bit of thick skin, an infectious enthusiasm for continual improvement, and an ability to maintain a community of professionals.
• Someone who is looking for more than just a paycheck. We can't stress this enough. Deep within all of us at Trilogy is the belief that our programs change lives. Each month we hear from countless students attesting to how our program brought them new skills, landed them new jobs, and a renewed sense of confidence. This impact is what our work is really about to us.
• You will be responsible for dreaming up and creating instructional activities for demonstrating key concepts in the area of financial technology -- on a part-time basis.
• You will be responsible for improving portions of our curriculum based on student learning data -- and continually asked to create improved content for teaching topics covered in our program.
• You will be responsible for staying abreast of technology trends and incorporate these trends into the curriculum.
• Lastly and most importantly, you will be responsible for making sure our program is the very best financial technology training program it can be. We want the person in this role to feel accountable to our students' success in the same way we hold ourselves accountable to their success in all other areas.

Are you a passionate FinTech Professional with a knack for changing lives? Do you love writing, teaching, and storytelling as much as you love writing Python code? Are you a Blockchain wizard who loves discussing the latest trends in the field? Then we may have the position for you.At Trilogy Education Services, we're creating programs to train new audiences for careers in the tech industry. Our programs are taught at the leading universities across the country including the University of Pennsylvania, University of California Berkeley, Northwestern, UNC Chapel Hill, Rutgers, UT Austin, and many others. We pride ourselves on building high-quality programs that help ambitious, hardworking adults change their lives through practical skills, fundamental knowledge, and the confidence to advance their careers.We're looking for a top-notch FinTech professional with a love for teaching, inspiring, and helping newcomers enter the field of financial technology. The program we're developing combines theoretical teaching with plenty of hands-on practical, skills-based training.Trilogy Education Services ( http://www.trilogyed.com/ ) is a Workforce Accelerator whose mission is to empower universities to transform the lives of students by preparing them for high-growth careers in the Digital Economy. We create and manage skills-based training programs that are university-run, student-tested, and employer-approved. Each Trilogy program is individually designed to meet the needs of regional employers, and to ensure that students graduate with both technical skills and personal confidence to succeed in their careers. The world's leading universities, including Northwestern School of Professional Studies, UC Berkeley Extension, and Rutgers Division of Continuing Studies, trust Trilogy to help their students meet the needs of the Digital Economy.We're a rapidly growing and established education company with thousands of students enrolled in our programs. We're data-driven -- with a startup like culture and tremendous opportunities to have a huge impact.Oh. And we're a ridiculously fun place to work.

title: Program Support Manager (FinTech)
text:
• Someone who has at least 2 years of project management experience
• A self-starter who can quickly understand/develop processes and approaches
• A leader motivated by helping others through mentorship, collaboration and support

Curriculum Success ManagerFull-TimeNYC / SF / Remoteup to 25%At Trilogy Education Services, we're creating innovative programs to train new audiences for careers in the digital economy. We're looking for people with passion, a demonstrated ability to learn on their feet, and a desire to escape the cubicle and stretch their creative muscles in new ways.The Academics team is looking for a talented and organized Curriculum Success Manager who can demonstrate effective communication, project management, and technical review skills to support a dedicated team of content developers supporting our customer facing 24-week classroom programs.This role will work with our Curriculum Manager and Curriculum Architect to help develop/support a standard review process for our content development by partnering with instructors and SMEs to ensure our content is providing a world class experience. This role will also provide operational support with curriculum pilots and launches.

summary: Lead solution development in Blockchain and related technologies such as Ethereum, and smart contracts. PoW, PoS,BFT, RBFT and PoETFamiliar with Blockchain...
title: Blockchain - HyperLedger Fabric Solution Architect
text:
newLedger solutions is a fully funded technology startup with committed clients developing solutions around blockchain. We are currently working to build a supply chain DLT for a publicly list company.

The team is currently focusing on cutting-edge programming working in an iterative agile environment and are looking for candidates that have a passion for technology. This is the ideal opportunity for someone that is looking to define the architecture and design of brand new platforms that will be built. This role will have high visibility and high impact across the technology side of the business.

The successful candidate will have the ability to drive technology as well as create a collaborative, communicate and fun engineering environment.

Demonstrate thought leadership and understanding of various Blockchain platforms and capabilities.

Validate proposed security architecture for digital currency/blockchain to meet industry policies and standards

Lead the evaluation, integration, and deployment of vendor products in data protection and key management for lines of business, provide feedback on risks associated with implementations

Articulate fact-based view regarding threats and risks in cryptocurrency and provide application security advice and guidance

Review new services to ensure for digital currency/blockchain to meet industry policy and standards

Design and build industry-specific solutions using the Blockchain technology

Lead solution development in Blockchain and related technologies such as Ethereum, and smart contracts.

Understand functional requirements as applicable to various industriesDefine architecture and best practices to implement the solutions.

Design and build Blockchain framework, accelerators, and assets.Document development artifacts and best practices.Draft functional specifications, Whitepapers

Coordinate and document Roadmap development

Requirements

Experience in application development and systems implementation.1+ year experience in Blockchain research, understanding and solution development.

Experience in NodeJS, GIT repositories, C++,Go or JavaScript and solidity, open source tools & technologies.

Must have experience with solution architecture, software architecture, and design of large-scale enterprise systems.

Extensive knowledge of Blockchain technology and various consensus protocols; PoW, PoS,BFT, RBFT and PoETFamiliar with Blockchain platforms like Hyperledger, Ethereum, R3 Corda, Ripple, Bluemix, Rubix.Basic understanding of cryptography, symmetric/asymmetric (public/private key), hash functions, encryption/signatures, Smart contracts: ERC 20,Chaincode

Preferred

Effective at building relationships with stakeholders, teams, and clients.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills to technical and non-technical audiences

PreferredExperience with Agile, Iterative or SCRUM Software development life cycle

Blockchain developing with Hyperledger Fabric and Composer. Experience Product OwnerExperience in a consulting environment with demonstrated collaboration, creativity, and innovation.Experience leading technical discussions, scoping decisions, and recommend best practices.

Contribution to open source projects on Blockchain.Experience with development using other DLT related technologies (Node.js, Go, Python, Composer, web3.js, Geth, Corda, etc.)Functional knowledge of data marketing Industry is a plus

To learn more about this exclusive opportunity, please apply below.

summary: 1、BS degree, or higher in CS 2、2+ years of experience working in developing infrastructure for large scale or distributed systems 3、Experience with Ethereum,...
title: Ant Financial Engineer for Blockchain San Mateo
text:
Ant Financial (https://www.antfin.com) is the highest valued FinTech company in the world, and we are hiring for Blockchain infrastructure team(a.k.a. Alibaba Damo Academy Blockchain Lab https://damo.alibaba.com/labs/blockchain). We are committed to the research and application of blockchain technology in commercial and financial applications and is a leader in developing proprietary industrial- and financial-grade blockchain systems. We are building our new R&D center in the Bay Area, and hiring for site leader, and engineers in all levels. The research focus on Blockchain infrastructures to address scalability, security and usability problems. Research areas includes storage systems, smart contracts and virtual machines, consensus protocols, security, cross-chain agreement and etc. 1、Design and implement Ant Blockchain’s fundamental infrastructure pieces to improve the system’s scalability, security and usability. 2、Work closely with team members, tech leaders, and engineers across other teams to collaborate on R&D efforts on related pieces and integrations 3、Conduct and lead full life cycle of infrastructure component developing, including design, POC, testing and integration with platform 

1、BS degree, or higher in CS 2、2+ years of experience working in developing infrastructure for large scale or distributed systems 3、Experience with Ethereum, Smart Contract and other major blockchain technologies is a major plus 4、Fluent with at least one of the major programming languages 5、Strong written and oral communication skills 6、Fluent in both English and Mandarin is preferred

text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

Gemini is seeking an Electronic Discovery (eDiscovery) and Litigation Support Subject Matter Expert (SME) to provide project management, guidance and technical expertise for an Enterprise eDiscovery practice and response. This individual will be working alongside internal and external investigators, internal and external counsel, and other entities to ensure compliance with and efficient responses to electronic discovery matters.
• Assist with the execution of an eDiscovery System program (investigators, management, attorneys, paralegals, project managers, etc.)
• Perform complex collections and searches, create workspaces and templates, designs workflows appropriate for data sets, and provides consultative support on best practices
• Coordinate documentation development as deliverables, such as Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), User Guidance.
• Develop eDiscovery workflows for the finding and collection of requested material
• Coordinate reviews and assist with analysis and processing as directed by counsel.
• Ensure the accuracy of data collected, manipulation, and conversion by performing and documenting quality checks.
• Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in the eDiscovery or forensics field
• Five (5) years of hands-on Electronic Discovery experience in the litigation support technology field
• Ability to work independently and excel in a high tempo operational environment
• Ability to define and analyze problems, and develop solutions

title: Legal Assistant
text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

The Legal department at Gemini is making history, paving the way when it comes to applying the legacy of law to the future of digital assets. On this team, we tackle complex and unprecedented applications of the current legal system to the revolutionary industry of cryptocurrency and blockchain technology. At Gemini, Legal plays a critical role in guiding innovation and driving value for the business, while upholding our core tenets of security, compliance, and trust for our customers. Join us and help define the Legal Department of the Future.

An excellent legal assistant is the backbone of a successful Legal Department. In this role, you will roll up your sleeves to create and improve processes, maintain records, and conduct legal research in the unchartered territory of digital assets, cryptocurrency, and blockchain technology. Working alongside the General Counsel and the rest of the Legal team, you will partner closely with key internal stakeholders across Engineering, Product, Compliance, Finance, Business Development, and Operations as we work to solve novel legal challenges in this groundbreaking territory.
• Provide exceptional, responsive, and meticulous support to a wide variety of projects undertaken by the Legal team.
• Successfully liaise with Leadership across all of Gemini’s internal departments, ensuring the employment of legal considerations when helping to solve problems and handling inbound requests.
• Research and deliver findings in the fintech and crypto industries that will help drive innovation for implementing legal policies across regions.
• Handle corporate governance matters and manage processes, policies, and formalities associated with Gemini’s status as a regulated trust company.
• Proactively manage tasks, including drafting agreements, processing and negotiating NDAs, data entry, organizing legal documents, and responding to subpoenas for employment legal records - all done in a timely and highly organized manner.
• Aid in the building of a nimble, impactful Legal function at Gemini
• Authorization to work in the United States and fluency in English.
• Ability to manage and prioritize numerous projects simultaneously in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.
• Flexibility and willingness to work on a broad range of legal matters.
• Demonstrated interest in disruptive technology and desire to learn.
• Ability to be a proactive self-starter who can thrive in ambiguity.

summary: EOS, Ethereum, Hyperledger. This is your chance to build a career in blockchain....
title: Blockchain Software Engineer
text:
This is your chance to build a career in blockchain. We are looking for an experienced software engineer to work in the fast paced Delivery team. You will work alongside a dynamic group of individuals to deliver exciting new products for internal and external customers. The products you will be creating are based on a revolutionary blockchain enabled platform. The digital object revolution is beginning and you can participate in the next wave of technical innovation.

In this role you will be working within a cross functional team to deliver software products for our client base. A working knowledge of SDLC frameworks (e.g. Agile) is necessary as well as the ability to quickly learn our suite of tools used in the product delivery process.
• Interact with the sales team to help scope the project based on a understanding of the clients needs
• Work with project management to execute against the agreed upon project deliverables
• Work with design team to help build the next generation interface
• Create dynamic digital objects across a variety of industry verticals and campaign types
• Provide support data for project reporting at the management and executive level
• Engage in post launch support activities to assure the product meets the customer throughout a campaign
• Deep interest in blockchain technology (1 or more years experience a plus)
• Experience working with crypto engineering or language and compiler design
• Experience with designing, implementing, or deploying blockchains on one or more of the following platforms: EOS, Ethereum, Hyperledger
• Expertise in any of these programming language such as C++, Solidity, Javascript.
• A firm grasp of data structure and algorithm fundamentals and how to apply them in real-world applications
• Experience delivering libraries or features to other developers (APIs, platforms, libraries, etc)
• Experience or interest in full-stack (NodeJS) development is a plus
• Fast learner. We're looking for team members who thrive on applying their knowledge, learning new technologies and who don't believe in one-size-fits-all solutions. You should be able to adapt easily to meet the rapid pace of a rapidly evolving research, development, and testing environment.
• Fearlessness. You think a working proof-of-concept is the best way to make a point. You strive to prove that speed and quality are not conflicting; that you can achieve both at the same time.
• Versatility. In addition to having an intimate knowledge of core engineering fields, you understand how all the pieces fit together into integrated systems, and how they impact performance.
• Passion. You feel ownership over everything you ship; you'd never call code or design "released" until you're confident it's correct. You pride yourself on efficient monitoring, strong documentation, and proper test coverage.
• A team player. You believe that you can achieve more on a team -- that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. You rely on others' candid feedback for continuous improvement.

Varius is at the forefront of a revolution in the use of next generation blockchain business solutions, products, and technologies. Our mission statement is to deliver value, transparency, and trust in a reimagined customer experience. The root of our name means to be different, to be diverse in our approach, and not just stick to ordinary. To achieve the unachievable for both ourselves and our clients.

text:
Our Blockchain/Digital Architect role is to be a trusted consultant to our clients around the development and deployment of innovative and transformational blockchain digital strategies, business solutions, and products. summary: Work with Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other cryptocurrency and cryptographic protocols and implementations. Commonwealth Crypto is one of the top venture-backed...
title: Backend Developer
text:
Commonwealth Crypto is one of the top venture-backed blockchain startups in Boston. We’re building a critical infrastructure layer for one of the fastest growing industries in the global innovation economy and we’re looking for an excellent developer who is ready to dive into the exciting blockchain ecosystem!

Our vision is to create the most secure standard of “trustless” exchange - two parties trading without having to trust each other or a third-party (who can be negligent or dishonest). What ‘Norton Secured’ did for ecommerce, we’re doing for crypto trading.

Our product allows traders to maintain custody their digital assets even while trading at a cryptocurrency exchange. Our tech ensures that no one, even a compromised or hacked exchange, has the power to take custody of a trader’s digital assets.

Our opportunity is to work on leading edge of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrency technology, bringing to market new ideas and products that were previously conceived only in a research lab, and establishing CwC as a leader in the space. Our team is incredibly motivated by this and we’re looking for a person who will join and add to that excitement.

Our culture is focused on our employees’ professional growth and development. We encourage and welcome diverse perspectives, lifelong learners, and challengers of the status quo. We aim to be transparent, inclusive, and supportive. Like any successful startup, we evaluate thoughtfully, and execute quickly. We are a "flat" team where everyone's opinion counts. We take pride in our work and our teammates.

About the role: As a backend engineer on our team, You'll be writing the application code for our secure cryptocurrency trading protocols. But this job is NOT just about writing code! You work with our core engineering team to deeply understand and contribute to the design of our secure cryptocurrency trading protocols.



You'll be doing C# development on Linux in AWS, and work with blockchain, networking, security, and storage solutions. Specifically, you will:
• Work with Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other cryptocurrency and cryptographic protocols and implementations
• Work with our founders and core team to design and improve our secure protocols for cryptocurrency trading
• Implement our secure trading protocols and APIs in C# on Linux in AWS.
• Use, integrate and contribute to a variety of open-source blockchain implementations
• Collaborate with our DevOps team to contribute to our world-class secure cloud deployment

We have years of experience training secure protocol, blockchain and crypto developers from the ground up, so we value applications from excellent engineers who want to make the transition into the blockchain/cryptocurrency space.
• Ability to prioritize, take responsibility for and deliver clean code
• Desire to learn about and work with cryptography, blockchain and security protocols
• You are sharp enough to understand the finer points of cryptography, blockchain and protocol design.
• You can think through all the steps required to develop component of secure code, and won't need us to hold your hand
• You have a background in cryptography, blockchain or fintech
• You have contributed to the development of blockchain or cryptography projects
• You have experience with C#
• You trade or own any digital assets.
• You have experience in fintech or capital markets.
• Our team is highly technical, motivated and bright. There is no better place to learn and geek out on blockchain and security
• You will play a key role in shaping the design and architecture of our platform
• Our company culture is built around the technical development of our engineers.
• You gain expertise in cryptography, cryptocurrency and secure cloud deployment from experts in the field.

We work out of a beautiful office in the heart of downtown Boston, in close proximity to our lead VC and other fintech startups, as well as a ton of interesting cafes and restaurants.

We offer competitive salary, benefits, and stock option plan, commensurate with experience.

The San Francisco office is responsible for improving and developing the TRON network blockchain, the smart contract developer tools, and covering all blockchain integration potential partners.
• Work closely with engineer team and provide support for the ecosystem of developer communities

summary: ConsenSys was started by co-founder of Ethereum Joseph Lubin, with over 50 projects and 1,000+ members around the world....
title: BlockChain Protocol Engineer - Kaleido
text:
• Strong back-end development experience using one of GO, Rust or Java
• Hands on experience in basic cryptography such as digital signature, encryption based on asymmetric or symmetric keys, key agreement
• Being able to explain consensus algorithms like Raft or Paxos, PBFT
• Excellent communicator who works well in extremely fast-paced team environments
• Thrives in chaos and is comfortable with the uncertainty and the rapid change of R&D projects
• Self-starter who can define and execute tasks with minimal guidance
• Knowledge in advanced cryptography a big plus such as group signature, zero knowledge proofs

Kaleido is a rapidly growing start-up aiming to make blockchain radically simple for organizations to adopt so that our societies will fully benefit from decentralized models and technologies. Kaleido, A ConsenSys Business, has partnered with Amazon Web Services to offer it's Blockchain Business Cloud -- the first all-in-one SaaS platform built for Enterprise Blockchain. It dramatically accelerates and simplifies private blockchain network creation and operation with click-button simplicity saving organizations months and millions in the process.Kaleido is set apart by its collaborative culture focused on putting people first and that's manifested in how we interact with each other, how we build products and solutions, and how we deliver them to our customers.We move fast, put real product in customers' hands, and iterate and learn as we move towards scale. This will allow you to make an immediate, high impact within a dedicated, and nimble team.Blockchain is a rapidly developing technology and we're excited to be one of the first pioneers in the field. Our team comes with deep technical experience and a dedication to our mission, but we still like to have fun and take full advantage of our startup environment by playing ping pong and foosball during breaks, enjoying a beer from the tap after work, team outings and more. Our team, based in urban startup hub Raleigh, NC., is continually growing and looking for more like-minded individuals. Find out more at https://kaleido.io ( https://kaleido.io )Kaleido is incubated by ConsenSys, a venture production studio and the leading technology firm in blockchain globally. ConsenSys was started by co-founder of Ethereum Joseph Lubin, with over 50 projects and 1,000+ members around the world. The ConsenSys mission is to use the decentralized solutions from its projects to fundamentally reshape the economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.We're looking for a Protocol Engineer - to join our agile development team focused on the deep blockchain layer. As active participants in the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance (EEA) and contributors to multiple open source projects (Quorum, Hyperledger Fabric), our protocol team is at the forefront of Enterprise adoption of blockchain technology. In addition to solving the challenge of running and scaling permissioned blockchain networks in mission-critical Enterprise use cases, this role is also working with open source communities around data privacy, cross-chain interoperability, using technique such as zero knowledge proofs and state channels. Blockchain is a rapidly evolving technology area that has attracted a lot of brilliant minds around the world both in academia and industry. This role will be on the bleeding edge of this exciting movement.A successful candidate will have opportunities to research and develop innovative approaches to some of the most challenging problems in software such as advanced cryptography and distributed systems.NICE TO HAVEKaleido is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and deeply values diversity. We strive to create an inclusive environment for the diverse cultures, perspectives, and experiences in our workforce.

summary: We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant...
title: Junior Technical Recruiter
text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

The People Team at Gemini is more than HR — we are thought partners, business influencers, and ambassadors for our company culture. Our tight-knit team is comprised of recruiters, program managers, and human resources specialists, and our job is a big one: create best-in-class processes and programs that find, grow, and retain amazing talent at Gemini.

As part of our newly created People Team, you’ll be on the ground floor of a quickly growing organization. This role will be instrumental in supporting the rapid scaling of Gemini’s Technology capability, and will grant the individual broad exposure to the many sub-departments within Technology. This position is full-time at Gemini’s offices in New York City, and will report to the Lead Technical Recruiter.
• Recruit and source a diverse slate of active and passive candidates across multiple technical openings: Software Engineering, Data Engineering, Front End, Mobile, Infrastructure, and more
• Create and foster high touch relationships with active and passive candidates
• Report on sourcing channel measures of success and interpret the data to suggest the viability of sourcing strategies and improvements as needed
• Analyze recruiting metrics to identify areas of improvement and provide data-driven recommendations
• Strategize different ways to build candidate pipelines and execute on tactical research, referral generation, events and sourcing campaigns
• Partner with leadership to understand the competitive landscape and gather insightful recruiting data
• 2+ years of technical recruiting and/or sourcing experience, preferably in a high-growth technology or startup environment
• A deep understanding of engineering functions and the ability to assess a candidate's technical skills
• Proven ability to proactively engage candidates and manage them through the interview process
• The capacity to act swiftly under pressure and adapt to changing priorities and processes
• Design, experiment and test new approaches to attracting diverse candidates to our open roles
• Proven track record for successfully identifying and hiring exceptional candidates in high growth environments
• Solid tech and industry knowledge with ability to understand relevant tech skills, target companies, conferences, open source communities
• Experience in leveraging creative sourcing techniques through multiple channels (web, social/professional networks, etc.)
• Proactively identify and assess talent using a variety of sourcing methodologies including but not limited to LinkedIn, Boolean searches, networking, complex web searches, environmental scanning and research

IT PAYS TO WORK HERE

text:
• Support the continuous evolution and execution of PegaSys' vision, strategy and go-to-market
• Guide activities to create a developer community around our products
• Help the many projects that PegaSys supports launch effectively
• Provide project management support/skills to R&D projects on an ongoing basis
• Assess, strategize and execute special projects as they come up
• Simultaneously kind, forthcoming with your opinions, and open-minded
• Able to provide input and thoughtful feedback on our strategy, while solving the operational challenges of today
• Biased towards action—you're not afraid to roll up your sleeves and just get things done
• Focused and able to function well in a self-managed environment
• Interested in deep technological problems and fascinated by the cutting-edge
• 2 to 4 years of work experience in management consulting, tech startups, VC, and/or business analyst role at a large technology company
• Proven ability to manage multiple priorities, workflows, and people to drive tasks to completion in a fast-paced environment
• Presentation skills and experience including for leadership teams and investors
• Demonstrated analytical skills. You know what questions to ask of data and are comfortable with Excel
• A brief message describing your interest, and why you think you're up to this job
• Optionally: the most interesting book you've read in 2017

The RoleThis highly visible role will help to bring PegaSys' products to market. This role is both strategic and operational. Your responsibilities will include: support strategic programs and help implement those programs, oversee operations for PegaSys teams such as R&D, support larger efforts to scale PegaSys products, position PegaSys within a complex and rapidly evolving market, and support business development efforts for clients and partnerships.This role will be part of the PegaSys Operations and Strategy team. We work closely with PegaSys and ConsenSys leadership, senior clients in numerous industries, and the Ethereum community.Key DutiesYou areRequirementsWe do not expect every applicant to meet all of the requirements. If you think you meet some of the requirements, and you're excited about the role, we welcome you to apply.PreferredWhen we interview you, we will be looking for people with high levels of emotional intelligence who are intellectually curious, and have the ability to communicate cross-culturally always being professional, dynamic in conversation, charismatic, and persuasive.You must be able to ask specific yet articulate questions, quickly synthesize insights from patterns in conversation, and reflect back the key points from a conversation in order to get alignment, commitments, and lay out next steps.About ConsenSysConsenSys is focused on building and scaling tools and software products for the Ethereum blockchain. Our mission is to use these solutions to empower decentralized networks for social, political, and business related use cases.Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, security and infrastructure, and more. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.The Protocol Engineering Group (PegaSys) team within ConsenSys creates and contributes to the software which operates Ethereum networks from the public chain to enterprise ecosystems. PegaSys is on a mission to enable the decentralized future by building a next-generation enterprise-grade blockchain platform.Want to learn more?If what we've described above feels exciting and challenging to you, please apply below with the following:

If something on the spaceship is broken we aim to fix it, if something can be automated we automate it, and we ship our code weekly.

• Proactively manage tasks, including drafting agreements, processing and negotiating NDAs, data entry, organizing legal documents, and responding to subpoenas for employment legal records - all done in a timely and highly organized manner.
• Aid in the building of a nimble, impactful Legal function at Gemini
• Authorization to work in the United States and fluency in English.
• Ability to manage and prioritize numerous projects simultaneously in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.
• Flexibility and willingness to work on a broad range of legal matters.
• Demonstrated interest in disruptive technology and desire to learn.
• Ability to be a proactive self-starter who can thrive in ambiguity.

text:
We are a fully funded blockchain startup that's looking to change the way that financial corporations communicate. Because of our recent influx of clients, we are looking to expand our development team. We currently have a team of about 50 employees based in Los Angeles - several engineers already work fully remote and we have all the tools for you to do so.

What's In It for You

text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

• Team player and self-starter with a passion for design and finding smart solutions to complex problems

summary: Work with Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other cryptocurrency and cryptographic protocols and implementations. Commonwealth Crypto is one of the top venture-backed...
title: Backend Developer
text:
Commonwealth Crypto is one of the top venture-backed blockchain startups in Boston. We’re building a critical infrastructure layer for one of the fastest growing industries in the global innovation economy and we’re looking for an excellent developer who is ready to dive into the exciting blockchain ecosystem!

Our vision is to create the most secure standard of “trustless” exchange - two parties trading without having to trust each other or a third-party (who can be negligent or dishonest). What ‘Norton Secured’ did for ecommerce, we’re doing for crypto trading.

Our product allows traders to maintain custody their digital assets even while trading at a cryptocurrency exchange. Our tech ensures that no one, even a compromised or hacked exchange, has the power to take custody of a trader’s digital assets.

Our opportunity is to work on leading edge of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrency technology, bringing to market new ideas and products that were previously conceived only in a research lab, and establishing CwC as a leader in the space. Our team is incredibly motivated by this and we’re looking for a person who will join and add to that excitement.

Our culture is focused on our employees’ professional growth and development. We encourage and welcome diverse perspectives, lifelong learners, and challengers of the status quo. We aim to be transparent, inclusive, and supportive. Like any successful startup, we evaluate thoughtfully, and execute quickly. We are a "flat" team where everyone's opinion counts. We take pride in our work and our teammates.

About the role: As a backend engineer on our team, You'll be writing the application code for our secure cryptocurrency trading protocols. But this job is NOT just about writing code! You work with our core engineering team to deeply understand and contribute to the design of our secure cryptocurrency trading protocols.



You'll be doing C# development on Linux in AWS, and work with blockchain, networking, security, and storage solutions. Specifically, you will:
• Work with Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other cryptocurrency and cryptographic protocols and implementations
• Work with our founders and core team to design and improve our secure protocols for cryptocurrency trading
• Implement our secure trading protocols and APIs in C# on Linux in AWS.
• Use, integrate and contribute to a variety of open-source blockchain implementations
• Collaborate with our DevOps team to contribute to our world-class secure cloud deployment

We have years of experience training secure protocol, blockchain and crypto developers from the ground up, so we value applications from excellent engineers who want to make the transition into the blockchain/cryptocurrency space.
• Ability to prioritize, take responsibility for and deliver clean code
• Desire to learn about and work with cryptography, blockchain and security protocols
• You are sharp enough to understand the finer points of cryptography, blockchain and protocol design.
• You can think through all the steps required to develop component of secure code, and won't need us to hold your hand
• You have a background in cryptography, blockchain or fintech
• You have contributed to the development of blockchain or cryptography projects
• You have experience with C#
• You trade or own any digital assets.
• You have experience in fintech or capital markets.
• Our team is highly technical, motivated and bright. There is no better place to learn and geek out on blockchain and security
• You will play a key role in shaping the design and architecture of our platform
• Our company culture is built around the technical development of our engineers.
• You gain expertise in cryptography, cryptocurrency and secure cloud deployment from experts in the field.

We work out of a beautiful office in the heart of downtown Boston, in close proximity to our lead VC and other fintech startups, as well as a ton of interesting cafes and restaurants.

We offer competitive salary, benefits, and stock option plan, commensurate with experience.

summary: EOS, Ethereum, Hyperledger. This is your chance to build a career in blockchain....
title: Blockchain Software Engineer
text:
This is your chance to build a career in blockchain. We are looking for an experienced software engineer to work in the fast paced Delivery team. You will work alongside a dynamic group of individuals to deliver exciting new products for internal and external customers. The products you will be creating are based on a revolutionary blockchain enabled platform. The digital object revolution is beginning and you can participate in the next wave of technical innovation.

In this role you will be working within a cross functional team to deliver software products for our client base. A working knowledge of SDLC frameworks (e.g. Agile) is necessary as well as the ability to quickly learn our suite of tools used in the product delivery process.
• Interact with the sales team to help scope the project based on a understanding of the clients needs
• Work with project management to execute against the agreed upon project deliverables
• Work with design team to help build the next generation interface
• Create dynamic digital objects across a variety of industry verticals and campaign types
• Provide support data for project reporting at the management and executive level
• Engage in post launch support activities to assure the product meets the customer throughout a campaign
• Deep interest in blockchain technology (1 or more years experience a plus)
• Experience working with crypto engineering or language and compiler design
• Experience with designing, implementing, or deploying blockchains on one or more of the following platforms: EOS, Ethereum, Hyperledger
• Expertise in any of these programming language such as C++, Solidity, Javascript.
• A firm grasp of data structure and algorithm fundamentals and how to apply them in real-world applications
• Experience delivering libraries or features to other developers (APIs, platforms, libraries, etc)
• Experience or interest in full-stack (NodeJS) development is a plus
• Fast learner. We're looking for team members who thrive on applying their knowledge, learning new technologies and who don't believe in one-size-fits-all solutions. You should be able to adapt easily to meet the rapid pace of a rapidly evolving research, development, and testing environment.
• Fearlessness. You think a working proof-of-concept is the best way to make a point. You strive to prove that speed and quality are not conflicting; that you can achieve both at the same time.
• Versatility. In addition to having an intimate knowledge of core engineering fields, you understand how all the pieces fit together into integrated systems, and how they impact performance.
• Passion. You feel ownership over everything you ship; you'd never call code or design "released" until you're confident it's correct. You pride yourself on efficient monitoring, strong documentation, and proper test coverage.
• A team player. You believe that you can achieve more on a team -- that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. You rely on others' candid feedback for continuous improvement.

Varius is at the forefront of a revolution in the use of next generation blockchain business solutions, products, and technologies. Our mission statement is to deliver value, transparency, and trust in a reimagined customer experience. The root of our name means to be different, to be diverse in our approach, and not just stick to ordinary. To achieve the unachievable for both ourselves and our clients.

summary: Have an interest in Blockchain and Ethereum. This work spans all layers of the (Enterprise) Ethereum protocol stack:....
title: Product Manager
text:
• Working collaboratively with other Product Managers within PegaSys and the broader Mesh to provide world class product management expertise across our business
• Working with the team to define and develop product strategy, business cases, and a product roadmap that achieves our product goals
• Partnering with internal and external prospective clients to understand and prioritize requirements. The ability to understand why technical features matter is crucial
• Collaborating closely with the engineering teams to compile a list of product requirements and associated timelines
• Assessing project progress, and providing status updates to stakeholders and the rest of the team
• Effectively communicating release schedule and changes to the team and any other impacted parties, while protecting the team from unrealistic delivery expectations
• 8+ years Product Management experience, most of which has been spent on deeply technical SaaS products
• Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work with constantly evolving, decentralized, diverse teams
• Effective verbal and written communication skills, able to write clearly and interact well with all levels of audience.
• An understanding of software development an ability to work closely with Technology teams in scheduling functional and non-functional requirements
• High emotional intelligence and the ability to empathize with users
• Experience coaching, motivating, and giving feedback to a team of developers
• Ability to thrive in an exciting team environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement
• Collaborative by nature; willingness to give and receive feedback
• Open to learning; flexible to the project you are working on
• Understanding we are globally distributed, remote-first team; Comfortable with managing uncertainty and ambiguity
• Have an interest in Blockchain and Ethereum
• Have experience coding and working with design systems/guides

About ConsenSysConsenSys is a venture production studio focused on building and scaling tools and enterprise software products powered by Ethereum. Our mission is to use these solutions to power the emerging economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, security and infrastructure, and more. If you're someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.The Protocol Engineering Group (PegaSys) team within ConsenSys creates and contributes to the software which operates Ethereum networks from the public chain to enterprise ecosystems. PegaSys is on a mission to enable the decentralized future by building a next-generation enterprise-grade blockchain platform.We are set to grow the ecosystem around blockchain and technologies through products that drive enterprise adoption of blockchains. This work spans all layers of the (Enterprise) Ethereum protocol stack: block processing, networking, storage, and cryptography. Some of the challenges we have been focusing on include security, scalability, performance and robustness.Our path to success lies in interactions and open source contributions coming from our engagement with ConsenSys Enterprise, academic, EEA, and Ethereum Foundation communities. Some of our notable engagements include our work in Dubai as City Blockchain Advisor, Swarm storage community, and EEA vision. Current ground-level activities revolve around re-architecture of blockchain clients like Geth and Quorum into modular, pluggable, and service-oriented components.The PegaSys team is expanding its product management capabilities and is seeking to build a Product Management team. We have four open roles, and the successful candidates will work with our engineering teams to define and develop product strategies and roadmaps that drive us to meet our ambitious product goals. The Product Managers will partner with internal and external parties to develop and prioritize high potential product opportunities. The products will be low-level and highly technical.You will have a strong bias toward action, will be comfortable with ambiguity in a rapidly evolving market, and will be excited to understand customer needs. The ideal candidate will also have experience collaborating with ambitious, low-level engineering teams and successfully bringing new products to market. You will also have:

summary: Experience with blockchain (e.g., Bitcoin or Ethereum) and distributed applications is a big plus. About Hedera Hashgraph:....
title: Software Developer
text:
• Develop various aspects of the Hedera Hashgraph Platform.
• Develop sample applications to demonstrate value and strength of the platform. Sample applications will include web, mobile and embedded development.
• Assist 3rd party developers in the development of a wide range of applications based on the Hedera platform, including financial transactions, gaming and database applications.
• Be a strong and proficient hands-on programmer, spending 80% of your time coding.
• Familiarity with and interest in mathematical concepts, principles and techniques
• Systems programming experience including providing services to other software (e.g.operating systems, computational science applications, game engines and AAA video games, industrial automation and software as a service applications)
• Proficiency in Java with knowledge of ecosystem of libraries and tools
• Deep knowledge of and experience with the Java VM, covering its strengths and weaknesses
• Experience in developing libraries and platforms for use and deployment by application developers
• Strong engineering principles and processes aimed at developing simple, modular and high-quality code
• Familiarity with test-driven software development processes and continuous integration tools and systems
• Experience with blockchain (e.g., Bitcoin or Ethereum) and distributed applications is a big plus
• Bachelor of Science or Master of Science degree, preferably from a high-credentialed school in Computer Science or similar discipline.
• The preferred experience with architectural design, but would consider someone with less experience with the right combination of skills.

We are a fast-growing company built around a revolutionary technology — the hashgraph consensus algorithm. Hedera Hashgraph is well-suited to become the world's first mass-adopted distributed public ledger because it is blazing fast, highly secure and ensures fairness. We are on a mission to create a trusted and empowered digital future for everyone; a cyberspace where you work, play, buy, sell, create, and engage socially; where you have safety and privacy in your digital communities; where you feel confident when interacting with others; where you own and control your information.Hedera is ambitious and fast-paced. We balance our enthusiasm with a measured approach to risk, and are well capitalized having raised over $100-million. Today, our team consists of more than 60 talented individuals, including many of the best minds in the industry. We are proud of our high-quality culture, dedicated to our values of integrity, ethics, service, excellence and teamwork.We are looking to hire effective, collegial and hard-working people to help achieve our vision. Join us and say, "Hello future."
