title: AML Compliance Officer
text:
• Assist with the evaluation of financial regulatory information, including evaluating for BSA compliance.
• Develop, implement and maintain risk assessment and control framework through strong compliance policies, standards and procedures related to BSA/AML risks.
• Conduct customer due diligence (CDD), enhanced due diligence (EDD), and third party due diligence as needed
• Responsible for writing, managing and ensuring timely and accurate filing of required reports to FinCEN such as SARs and CTRs
• Conduct annual BSA/AML and OFAC risk assessments and updates to the Company`s compliance program.
• Preparing management and board reporting that includes insights and analysis based on industry-leading knowledge of BSA/AML topics.
• Prepare the Company to undergo an annual independent review.
• Provide oversight and input for AML Compliance training to employees
• 3+ years of experience with implementing or analyzing financial regulatory compliance programs
• Knowledge of BSA and AML regulations and equivalent compliance programs implemented by regulated institutions
• Knowledge of conducting investigations, examinations, or audits of financial institutions
• Knowledge of the analysis of people, activities, methods, or trends, including money laundering, financial crime or other illicit activities
• Ability to write concisely and clearly with minimal editing
• Broad financial services knowledge and knowledge of industry best practices for continuously improving a proactive BSA/AML program.
• Strong collaboration and leadership abilities to strategically manage to high performance outcomes. 



We are seeking an experienced AML Compliance Officer to join our team in Atlanta, Ga (Buckhead area). However, remote employment will be considered if you are not local.Who we are:Bitcoin Depot is one of the largest multi-cryptocurrency ATM Networks in the world offering users the ability to buy and sell Bitcoin, Litecoin, Ethereum, and Bitcoin Cash instantly at hundreds of locations. Our mission is to provide the most secure, convenient, and fastest cryptocurrency transaction. Our vision is to bring cryptocurrency market to the masses. Go to bitcoindepot.com for more informationAbout the role:The Compliance officer will be responsible for leading, enhancing and maintaining the Company`s Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) compliance program, including Know Your Customer, Customer Due Diligence and Enhanced Due Diligence activities. He or she will be responsible for developing a strategic plan to enhance our existing program and successfully executing upon that plan.What you`ll do:Our Ideal Candidate:Skills and Abilities:What We Offer:

summary: Ethereum itself is still a toddler. Demonstrated interest in Ethereum, smart contracts, and/or cryptoeconomics....
title: Front-End Engineer, Panvala
text:
• Write automated tests that demonstrate that the software functions as expected
• Estimate the amount of work features, bugs, and tasks will take to complete
• Desire to work in a company that strives to operate with minimal hierarchy
• Desire and competence for self-directed work that produces value without needing to be told what is worth doing
• Familiarity with the legal landscape around cryptocurrencies
• The forefront of a revolution. At ConsenSys we fundamentally believe that a next generation of technologies presents the opportunity to create a more just and equitable society.
• A dynamic startup environment. ConsenSys is a thought leader in the blockchain space and we are absorbing a significant portion of the mindshare. This is both exciting and challenging, as we learn to scale our organization while adhering to the principles of decentralization.
• Continuous learning. You'll be constantly exposed to new languages, frameworks and ideas from your peers and as you work on different projects -- challenging you to stay at the top of your game.
• Deep technical challenges. This entire ecosystem is about 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler. There is much work to be done before these platforms can scale to the order of millions or billions of users. ConsenSys is building the technology platforms that can get us to those next thresholds of scale.

ConsenSys is a venture production studio and the leading technology firm in blockchain globally. We deliver products, solutions and platforms built using blockchain technology to transform how business is done in complex network of buyers, suppliers and consumers.Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, the music industry, security, and infrastructure, and more. To accomplish this we've built out a flat organizational structure which we call the ConsenSys Mesh: a network of individuals & teams working autonomously and towards the same goal. Our mission is to use these decentralized solutions to fundamentally reshape the economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.ConsenSys Diligence is expanding its efforts on smart contract security ( https://consensys.github.io/smart-contract-best-practices ) to meet the needs of external clients such as 0x, TrueBit, and Aragon, as well as home-grown platforms including uPort ( https://uport.me/ ), Gnosis ( http://gnosis.pm/ ), and Virtue Poker ( https://virtue.poker/ ), and enterprise clients. Our aim is to build the most technically-gifted and engineering-focused blockchain security team.As a developer at ConsenSys Diligence, you will help to develop Panvala ( https://www.panvala.com/ ), a decentralized, token-based system that helps the community mark contracts that meet their safety standards, and issue token grants to fund work that makes Ethereum safer. We believe that Panvala's design can coordinate cooperation at a greater scale than most communities are familiar with. If we're right, your work will show the world how to cooperate in a new way.ResponsibilitiesRequirementsBonus PointsHere are some of the perks of being part of a unique organization like ConsenSys:Click here ( http://bit.ly/2J0PwfB ) for the latest updates from ConsenSys.

summary: Bitcoin, Hyperledger or Ethereum. Strong systems background with experience with Ethereum Virtual Machine. We are seeking a Blockchain Engineer with a strong...
title: Blockchain Engineer: Systems Background
text:
• High proficiency with client side JavaScript frameworks (preferably React/Redux), server side frameworks (preferably NodeJS), NoSQL databases (preferably MongoDB), and some exposure to relational database concepts
• Ability to integrate with and manage APIs exposing microservices (REST, JSON-RPC), including development and support of Java/JavaScript services
• Experience in or with:
• Blockchain, web and enterprise related technologies such as go-ethereum/Solidity, Node.js, AngularJS, Python, Go, or Rust.
• Low-level application development in C++ or Go
• Translate complex business needs into innovative technical solutions and contribute to product advancement to guarantee solutions are designed for successful deployment
• Develop high quality prototypes, proofs of concept in addition to production‐quality solutions
• Ensure efficient performance and scalability of solutions - optimize applications for maximum speed
• Be available for level 3 support to triage production issues
• Stay current on emerging technologies and participate in Blockchain or cryptocurrency consortiums and industry events

Omega One is accelerating the transformation of our financial system to a world powered by digital assets. By solving the foundational challenges of exchange liquidity, asset security, and market transparency, Omega One is bringing institutional capital into the crypto markets, catalyzing the broader adoption of digital assets. Omega One is the world's most advanced trading platform, providing institutions and serious individual traders with low-cost access to market tools usually reserved for the world's most technically-sophisticated hedge funds: a dark pool, aggregated liquidity, smart order routing, custodial and non-custodial solutions, an advanced signals marketplace, and more, accessed via robust APIs and front-end interfaces that allow for market leading trade execution. Come join alumni from Bridgewater, Goldman Sachs, ConsenSys, Morgan Stanley, NYSE, the SEC, and the CFTC, as Omega One works to fundamentally re-architect our financial system.We are seeking a Blockchain Engineer with a strong systems background and experience with the Ethereum Virtual Machine to help us build our cutting edge cryptocurrency trading platform for highly sophisticated and demanding cryptocurrency traders across the globe. The ideal candidate will be a blockchain expert, with previous experience in a global financial services or fintech firm working on a trading platform and on large scale, high traffic web applications. Ideally you will have experience in or at least a strong personal interest and willingness to learn more about cryptocurrency. The Blockchain Engineer will be working on designing and building cutting edge technology solutions that do not yet exist today.Since we're building the first of its kind cryptocurrency exchange trading platform, we're looking for engineers who are passionate about emerging business & technology models as well as working in a space full of unknowns. This is an excellent opportunity for any engineer seeking to explore new ideas with the team. We need engineers who are enthusiastic and rigorous when tackling new problems, extremely versatile, who thrive in an agile, test-driven development and automated testing environment.

All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

summary: Omega One is accelerating the transformation of our financial system to a world powered by digital assets. By solving the foundational challenges of exchange...
title: Software Engineer
text: Omega One is accelerating the transformation of our financial system to a world powered by digital assets. By solving the foundational challenges of exchange liquidity, asset security, and market transparency, Omega One is bringing institutional capital into the crypto markets, catalyzing the broader adoption of digital assets. Omega One is the world's most advanced trading platform, providing institutions and serious individual traders with low-cost access to market tools usually reserved for the world's most technically-sophisticated hedge funds: a dark pool, aggregated liquidity, smart order routing, custodial and non-custodial solutions, an advanced signals marketplace, and more, accessed via robust APIs and front-end interfaces that allow for market leading trade execution. Come join alumni from Bridgewater, Goldman Sachs, ConsenSys, NYSE, the SEC, and the CFTC, as Omega One works to fundamentally re-architect our financial system.We​ ​are​ ​seeking​ ​a​ ​Full​ ​Stack​ ​Developer​ ​to​ ​help​ ​us​ ​build​ ​our​ ​cutting​ ​edge​ ​cryptocurrency​ ​trading platform​ ​for​ ​highly​ ​sophisticated​ ​cryptocurrency​ ​traders​ ​across​ ​the​ ​globe.​ ​You​ ​must​ ​be​ ​willing and​ ​able​ ​to​ ​learn​ ​everything​ ​about​ ​our​ ​product​ ​and​ ​end​ ​user​ ​needs​ ​and​ ​deliver​ ​against​ ​the Omega​ ​One​ ​vision​ ​outlined​ ​in​ ​our​ ​white​ ​paper​ ​through​ ​go​ ​live.The​ ​ideal​ ​candidate​ ​will​ ​have​ ​experience​ ​in​ ​a​ ​global​ ​financial​ ​services​ ​or​ ​fintech​ ​firm​ ​working on​ ​a​ ​trading​ ​platform​ ​and​ ​on​ ​large​ ​scale,​ ​high​ ​traffic​ ​web​ ​sites​ ​and​ ​applications,​ ​as​ ​well​ ​as blockchain.​ ​Ideally​ ​you​ ​will​ ​have​ ​experience​ ​in​ ​or​ ​at​ ​least​ ​willingness​ ​to​ ​learn​ ​more​ ​about cryptocurrency.​ ​The​ ​Full​ ​Stack​ ​Developer​ ​will​ ​work​ ​closely​ ​with​ ​our​ ​Product​ ​Manager,​ ​business leads​ ​and​ ​user​ ​community​ ​to​ ​ensure​ ​that​ ​all​ ​client-facing​ ​functions​ ​and​ ​features​ ​on​ ​both​ ​our website​ ​and​ ​mobile​ ​apps​ ​are​ ​intuitive,​ ​fast,​ ​efficient​ ​and​ ​fully​ ​meet​ ​our​ ​clients'​ ​trading​ ​and security​ ​needs.​ ​Our​ ​platform​ ​will​ ​run​ ​24x7,​ ​so​ ​we​ ​need​ ​a​ ​developer​ ​who​ ​is​ ​expert​ ​at​ ​managing changes​ ​and​ ​updates​ ​real-time​ ​with​ ​little​ ​room​ ​for​ ​any​ ​downtime​ ​or​ ​failover.Since​ ​we're​ ​building​ ​the​ ​first​ ​of​ ​its​ ​kind​ ​cryptocurrency​ ​exchange​ ​trading​ ​platform,​ ​we're looking​ ​for​ ​engineers​ ​who​ ​are​ ​passionate​ ​about​ ​emerging​ ​business​ ​&​ ​technology​ ​models​ ​as well​ ​as​ ​working​ ​in​ ​a​ ​space​ ​full​ ​of​ ​unknowns.​ ​This​ ​is​ ​an​ ​excellent​ ​opportunity​ ​for​ ​any​ ​engineer seeking​ ​to​ ​explore​ ​new​ ​ideas​ ​with​ ​the​ ​team.​ ​We​ ​need​ ​engineers​ ​who​ ​are​ ​enthusiastic​ ​and rigorous​ ​when​ ​tackling​ ​new​ ​problems,​ ​extremely​ ​versatile,​ ​who​ ​thrive​ ​in​ ​an​ ​agile,​ ​test-driven development​ ​and​ ​automated​ ​testing​ ​environment.-----------------

summary: A leading licensed digital asset exchange and custodian that offers a platform for customers to buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum,...
title: Head of Regulatory Affairs
text:
A leading licensed digital asset exchange and custodian that offers a platform for customers to buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) seeks a Head of Regulatory Affairs.

What you will do:

The Regulatory Officer will act as the central point of contact for all regulatory inquiries. In this role, you will manage visits from regulators by organizing agendas, contributing at meetings, and ensuring consistency of message on cross-functional issues. You will exercise your industry expertise and influence skills to assist the Chief Compliance Officer to deal with regulatory inspections, meetings, queries and reporting requirements.
• Answer regulators ad-hoc queries about the businesses and its products,
• Understand the regulatory risks of the products offered by and business activities; analyze and evaluate new products to determine compliance with established rules and regulations.
• Ensure compliance of existing risk processes which includes providing advice on how to amend risk models or processes to comply with specific local regulations, highlighting potential regulatory issues.
• Produce management information and facilitate reporting to senior management to ensure that all regulatory issues are identified and addressed appropriately.
• Coordinate the response to subpoenas and other law enforcement requests made of the company; serve as the escalation point for customer complaints, ensuring that the firm’s response to customers and regulators are accurate and complete.
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Risk Management or related field, or equivalent experience
• Minimum of 7-10 years of regulatory coordinator or officer experience in the financial services industry with specific experience with the NYDFS
• A blend of BOTH government regulatory experience AND corporate experience in which work with regulators was a key component (e.g. experience with FINRA, SEC, CFTC and other financial regulators)

summary: A licensed digital asset exchange and custodian, that offers a platform for customers to buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash...
title: Head of Internal Audit
text:
A little about the company:

A licensed digital asset exchange and custodian, that offers a platform for customers to buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) seeks a Head of Internal Audit.

What you will do:

Prepare and implement a risk-based annual audit plan to assess adequacy and effectiveness of financial reporting, operational and risk management controls.
• Collaborate with the second line of defense (Head of Risk) to support the development of the annual audit plan based on the enterprise risk assessment.
• Execute audits with the first line of defense (management) through walkthroughs and evaluation of supporting artifacts/evidence to verify that internal controls are being followed.
• Report results of audit engagements to the Audit Committee of the Board.
• Collaborate with management to ensure audit issues are resolved in a timely manner.

*

Qualifications the company would like:
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Risk Management or related field, or commensurate work experience
• Minimum of 7 years of financial and IT audit experience in the financial services industry or Minimum of 5 years of Big 4 public accounting experience
• Deep, extensive knowledge of auditing standards and procedures, laws, rules and regulations

summary: Experience with Ethereum or other blockchain protocols. As an experienced Software Engineer, your mission is to help lead our team of innovators and...
title: Quorum GoLang Blockchain Engineer
text:
As an experienced Software Engineer, your mission is to help lead our team of innovators and technologists toward creating next-level solutions that improve the way our business is run. Your deep knowledge of design, analytics, development, coding, testing and application programming will help your team raise their game, meeting your standards, as well as satisfying both business and functional requirements. Your expertise in various technology domains will be counted on to set strategic direction and solve complex and mission critical problems, internally and externally. Your quest to embracing leading-edge technologies and methodologies inspires your team to follow suit. And best of all, you’ll be able to harness massive amounts of brainpower through our global network of technologists from around the world. 

 Quorum is looking for passionate and experienced software engineers to join its growing team of expert engineers. 

 You will be a core member of our cross-functional group of engineers, product managers, and strategists at the forefront of innovation building robust, enterprise level, performance and secure applications on distributed, decentralized platforms. 

 There are multiple roles varying from full stack, distributed systems engineers to performance and applied cryptography engineers.
• Design and build core Quorum components to meet protocol requirements and advances in the distributed ledger technology domain, as well as business applications
• Collaborate with the core engineering team and open source community
• Implement rigorous and thorough testing practices to ensure the security and performance goals of blockchain infrastructure
• Implement rigorous and thorough monitoring and testing practices to ensure the security and performance goals of blockchain infrastructure
• Design and verify cryptographic protocols deployed in the blockchain
• At least 5 years as software development engineer or equivalent hands-on experience
• Advanced knowledge in GoLang and at least one of the following programing languages:
• Experience with cloud services such as AWS, GCP, or Azure
• Experience with Ethereum or other blockchain protocols
• Working knowledge with Docker, Vagrant, or other container platforms

Our Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the world’s important corporations, governments and institutions. You’ll develop solutions for a bank entrusted with holding $18 trillion of assets and $393 billion in deposits. CIB provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk, and extends liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world

When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.

At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.
